definition: to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
to appraise/to pass judgment on/to speak ill of/praise and censure/appraisal
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to banish from the court/to relegate
to get more criticism than praise
dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style
to expect (a currency etc) to depreciate

sentences.english: From it we can find any critics or praise for a building are relative.
sentences.chinese: 對於任何建築的褒與貶都是相對而言的。

sentences.english: Have to its evaluation honour have demote .
The Travel Notes to Shizhong Mount shows Su Shi's implicit rebel after being demoted.
sentences.chinese: 《石鐘山記》是蘇軾遭貶後的含蓄反抗。

sentences.english: The lengthy historical novel" the Romance of the Three Kingdoms" inside, displays obviously censures Cao.
sentences.chinese: 長篇歷史小說《三國演義》裏面，表現出明顯的貶曹。

sentences.english: Some have used his arrival to damn Lampard with faint praise.
sentences.chinese: 有些人已經用他的到來對蘭帕德名褒實貶。

sentences.english: This idiom, do not praise to do not devaluate apparently, just spoke a kind of phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 這個成語，似乎不褒不貶，只是說出了一種現象而已。

to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
